metadata.title: CVE-2018-12401 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
Some special resource URIs will cause a non-exploitable crash if loaded with optional parameters following a '?' in the parsed string. This could lead to denial of service (DOS) attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 63.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
